Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: the library
The warm, dim libary.

Windows look out from the library onto the porch and patio. Tall bookcases line the walls; a rugged fireplace keeps the room comfortably warm, and the lights are dim. A massive table is set on an oriental rug in the middle of the room; a couple of comfortable armchairs and a sofa are present also.
http://www.skotos.net/MansionGame/images/Library.jpg
the western door
In the middle of the west wall is a panelled oak door. A brass knob is attached to the edge of the door.
the stuffed antelope over the fireplace
Mounted on the chimney front, over the fireplace, is the stuffed head of an antelope. His horns curl up and back in a grand sweep; his eyes gaze blankly at the middle of the room.
the low bookcase east of the fireplace

This is a massive glass-fronted bookcase, about four feet tall, made in a simple, massive craftsman style of dark, cherry-stained oak. It has three shelves inside, and can hold many books. Dark metal pulls can be used to open it; a small lock can secure it shut. The bookcase stands just east of the fireplace, along the southern wall.
A low, glass-fronted oak bookcase.

A low, massive cherry-stained oak bookcase, with lockable glass-fronted doors. It has several shelves inside, and can hold many books. The bookcase stands just east of the fireplace, along the southern wall.
the low eastern bookcase's shelves
The four shelves of a low, glass-fronted oak bookcase. The bookcase is standing against the south wall.
The shelves of a low, glass-fronted bookcase.
the low eastern bookcase's top
The top of a low, cherry-stained oak bookcase, standing against the south wall just east of the fireplace.
The top of a low wooden bookcase, by the fireplace.
the low bookcase west of the fireplace

This is a massive glass-fronted bookcase, about four feet tall, made in a simple, massive craftsman style of dark, cherry-stained oak. It has three shelves inside, and can hold many books. Dark metal pulls can be used to open it; a small lock can secure it shut. The bookcase stands just west of the fireplace, along the southern wall.
A low, glass-fronted oak bookcase.

A low, massive cherry-stained oak bookcase, with lockable glass-fronted doors. It has several shelves inside, and can hold many books. The bookcase stands just west of the fireplace, along the southern wall.
the low western bookcase's shelves
The four shelves of a low, glass-fronted oak bookcase. The bookcase is standing against the south wall, west of the fireplace.
The shelves of a low, glass-fronted bookcase.
the low western bookcase's top
The top of a low, cherry-stained oak bookcase, standing against the south wall just west of the fireplace.
The top of a low wooden bookcase.
the eastern tall glass-fronted oak bookcase

This is a massive glass-fronted bookcase, about seven feet tall, made in a simple, massive craftsman style of dark, cherry-stained oak. It has four shelves inside, and can hold many books. Dark metal pulls can be used to open it; a small lock can secure it shut. It is standing against the northern wall, just east of the windows.
A glass-fronted oak bookcase.
A massive cherry-stained oak bookcase, with lockable glass-fronted doors. It has several shelves inside, and can hold many books. It is standing just east of the northern windows.
the eastern tall bookcase's shelves
The four shelves of a glass-fronted oak bookcase.
The shelves of a glass-fronted bookcase.
the eastern tall bookcase's top
The top of a cherry-stained oak bookcase; the bookcase is standing against the library's north wall, just east of the windows.
The top of a wooden bookcase.
western tall glass-fronted oak bookcase

This is a massive glass-fronted bookcase, about seven feet tall, made in a simple, massive craftsman style of dark, cherry-stained oak. It has four shelves inside, and can hold many books. Dark metal pulls can be used to open it; a small lock can secure it shut. It is standing against the northern wall, just west of the windows.
A glass-fronted oak bookcase.
A massive cherry-stained oak bookcase, with lockable glass-fronted doors. It has several shelves inside, and can hold many books. It is standing just west of the northern windows.
the western tall bookcase's shelves
The four shelves of a glass-fronted oak bookcase.
The shelves of a glass-fronted bookcase.
the western tall bookcase's top
The top of a cherry-stained oak bookcase; the bookcase is standing against the library's north wall, just west of the windows.
The top of a wooden bookcase.
the eastern comfortable armchair

This heavy, comfortable craftsman-style armchair is built from cherry-stained oak, with dark brown leather-covered cushions and padding on the seat, back and arms. The leather is attached to the frame with smooth, dark brass rivets. It is set under one of the northern windows of the library, to the east of a floor lamp and another armchair.
A comfortable, leather-upholstered oak armchair.
the eastern armchair's arm
Both arms of each comfortable armchair are cushioned with dark brown leather, held to the frames by smooth, dark brass rivets.
The arms of this comfortable armchair are leather padded.
the back of the eastern armchair
The broad backs of the comfortable armchairs are cushioned with dark brown leather, held to the frames by smooth, dark brass rivets.
The back of this armchair is cushioned with leather.
the eastern armchair's leg
The four legs of each comfortable armchair are square, carved from cherry-stained oak in a craftsman style.
The legs of this comfortable armchair are angular cherry-stained oak.
the armchair's upholstery rivets
The comfortable armchair's seat, back and arms are covered in dark brown leather, secured along the edges with smooth, dark brass rivets.
The comfortable armchair's leather cushions and paddings are attached with smooth, dark brass rivets.
the eastern armchair's seat
The comfortable armchair's seat is covered in smooth dark brown leather, secured along the edges with smooth, dark brass rivets.
The comfortable armchair's seat is cushioned with brown leather.
the western comfortable armchair

This heavy, comfortable craftsman-style armchair is built from cherry-stained oak, with dark brown leather-covered cushions and padding on the seat, back and arms. The leather is attached to the frame with smooth, dark brass rivets. It is set under one of the northern windows of the library, to the west of a floor lamp and another armchair.
A comfortable, leather-upholstered oak armchair.
the western armchair's arm
Both arms of each comfortable armchair are cushioned with dark brown leather, held to the frames by smooth, dark brass rivets.
The arms of this comfortable armchair are leather padded.
the back of the western armchair
The broad backs of the comfortable armchairs are cushioned with dark brown leather, held to the frames by smooth, dark brass rivets.
The back of this armchair is cushioned with leather.
the western armchair's leg
The four legs of each comfortable armchair are square, carved from cherry-stained oak in a craftsman style.
The legs of this comfortable armchair are angular cherry-stained oak.
the armchair's upholstery rivets
The comfortable armchair's seat, back and arms are covered in dark brown leather, secured along the edges with smooth, dark brass rivets.
The comfortable armchair's leather cushions and paddings are attached with smooth, dark brass rivets.
the western armchair's seat
The comfortable armchair's seat is covered in smooth dark brown leather, secured along the edges with smooth, dark brass rivets.
The comfortable armchair's seat is cushioned with brown leather.
the chimney

The heavy, rough chimney of the library fireplace rises straight up the the ceiling, without a mantel shelf. The stuffed head of a large antelope is hung on the chimney, starily into the center of the room. Framed portraits hang on either side of the chimney.
the fire
A dying log fire is warming the library from within the fireplace.
the fireplace
A heavy, rusticated fireplace is built into the south wall, with a dying fire within it. The stuffed head of a large antelope is mounted on the chimneyfront. The oak sofa is facing the fireplace.
the eastern floor lamp

This is an electric floor lamp about five feet tall, made from cherry-stained oak. There is a shade made from finely-pleated tan fabric, in the shape of a truncated four-sided pyramid. A short, black rubber cord leads from the base. The lamp is standing againt the eastern wall, just south of the window seat.
This is tall electric floor lamp, made from cherry-stained oak with a tan fabric shade.
the eastern floor lamp's base
The four angular wooden feet at the base of the tall floor lamp support its shaft.
The four angular wooden feet of the tall floor lamp support its shaft.
the eastern floor lamp's bulb
Within the tan, rectangular shade of a tall floor lamp is an incandescent light bulb.
Within the tan, rectangular shade of a tall floor lamp is a light bulb.
the eastern floor lamp's cord
The short, black rubber-covered cord of an electric floor lamp. One end is attached to the base of the lamp; the other ends in a two-pronged plug.
The short, rubber-covered cord of an electric floor lamp.
the eastern floor lamp's rectangular shade
The tall floor lamp has a pleated tan fabric shade, in a truncated pyramidal shape. A brass harp holds the shade away from the bulb.
The tall floor lamp has a pleated tan fabric shade, in a truncated pyramidal shape.
the eastern floor lamp's shaft
This is the square oak shaft of a tall electric floor lamp. About five feet high, it supports the bulb and shade at the top of the lamp, and in turn is supported by the lamp base.
This is the square oak shaft of a tall electric floor lamp. It supports the bulb and shade at the top of the lamp, and in turn is supported by the lamp base.
the northern floor lamp

This is an electric floor lamp about five feet tall, made from cherry-stained oak. There is a shade made from finely-pleated tan fabric, in the shape of a truncated four-sided pyramid. A short, black rubber cord leads from the base. The lamp is standing between the northern windows (and thus also between the armchairs below the windows).
This is tall electric floor lamp, made from cherry-stained oak with a tan fabric shade.
the northern floor lamp's base
The four angular wooden feet at the base of the tall floor lamp support its shaft.
The four angular wooden feet of the tall floor lamp support its shaft.
the northern floor lamp's bulb
Within the tan, rectangular shade of a tall floor lamp is an incandescent light bulb.
Within the tan, rectangular shade of a tall floor lamp is a light bulb.
the northern floor lamp's cord
The short, black rubber-covered cord of an electric floor lamp. One end is attached to the base of the lamp; the other ends in a two-pronged plug.
The short, rubber-covered cord of an electric floor lamp.
the northern floor lamp's rectangular shade
The tall floor lamp has a pleated tan fabric shade, in a truncated pyramidal shape. A brass harp holds the shade away from the bulb.
The tall floor lamp has a pleated tan fabric shade, in a truncated pyramidal shape.
the northern floor lamp's shaft
This is the square oak shaft of a tall electric floor lamp. About five feet high, it supports the bulb and shade at the top of the lamp, and in turn is supported by the lamp base.
This is the square oak shaft of a tall electric floor lamp. It supports the bulb and shade at the top of the lamp, and in turn is supported by the lamp base.
the dim electric lamp fixtures
Ornate brass electric lamp fixtures hang from the ceiling. Each has several frosted glass globes which glow dimly, keeping the library in a sort of gloom. Two floor lamps stand against the walls.
the portrait to the left of the chimney
Hanging to the left of the chimney, above a low bookcase, is a framed oil portrait of a bewhiskered old man, wearing a frock coat and high collar. The old man has a stern, unforgiving expression.
the portrait to the left of the chimney

Hanging to the right of the chimney, above a low bookcase, is a framed oil portrait of a gray-haired old woman, wearing a black high-collared dress. The old woman has a stern, disapproving expression.
large oriental rug
This is a large, rectangular, oriental rug with bright designs woven into it. It is laid in the middle of the library; a massive library table and an oak sofa are standing on the rug.
An oriental rug covered with bright designs; it is lying on the library floor.
oriental rug's edges
The tasselled sides of an oriental rug.
oriental rug's center
The center of an oriental rug, laid in the middle of the floor. A massive library table and an oak sofa are standing on the middle of the rug.
the massive leather-upholstered oak sofa

This massive, comfortable craftsman-style sofa is built from cherry-stained oak, with dark brown leather-covered cushions and padding on the seat, back and sides. The back and arms are level with each other, and only thirty inches high. The sofa is standing on an oriental rug, with its back against the library table; the sofa is facing the fireplace.
A massive, leather-upholstered cherry-stained oak sofa, facing the fireplace.
the sofa's arm
Both arms of this massive sofa are flat cherry-stained oak boards, wide enough to easily rest a book -- or a drink -- on.
The arms of this massive sofa are smooth, flat oak boards.
the back of the massive sofa
The broad back of this massive oak sofa is cushioned with dark brown leather, and rises to only thirty inches above the floor. It is pushed up against, and level with, the top of the library table.
The back of the sofa is cushioned with leather.
the sofa's leg
The six legs of this massive sofa (including two under the middle) are square, carved from cherry-stained oak in a craftsman style.
The legs of this massive sofa are angular cherry-stained oak.
the massive sofa's seat
The massive oak sofa's seat is covered in smooth dark brown leather cushions.
The massive sofa's seat is cushioned with brown leather.
the massive oak library table

This massive library table is made from cherry-stained oak, in a simple, angular craftsman style. A wide stretcher shelf, below the top of the table, connects the legs. The table is set on the middle of an oriental rug, in the center of the library. A sofa is pushed up against one of the long edges of the table.
This is a massive cherry-stained oak library table, set on an oriental rug in the middle of the library.
the oak library table's edge
The thick edges of the top of a massive cherry-stained oak library table. A sofa is pushed up against one of the long edges.
The thick edge of the top of an oak library table.
the oak library table's end
The end of a massive cherry-stained oak library table.
The end of an oak library table.
the massive oak library table's legs
The legs of a library table are massive pieces of cherry-stained oak, built in an angular craftsman style. The legs are connected by a wide, thick stretcher shelf, half the height of the table top.
The two wide legs of the oak library table are connected by a shelf.
the oak library table's center
The center of the top surface of a massive cherry-stained oak library table.
The center of the oak library table.
the oak library table's stretcher shelf
The legs of an oak library table are connected by a wide, thick stretcher shelf, half the height of the table top.
The legs of the oak library table are connected by a wide, thick shelf.
the view of the patio through the eastern window
Through the eastern window, you can see:
Through the eastern window, you can see:
the view of the porch through the northern windows
Through the northern windows, you can see:
Through the northern windows, you can see:
the east wall

Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the east wall of the hall; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall, up to the ceiling cornice. A window looks out onto the porch from this wall; a wide window seat (or sort of built-in couch) is set under the window. A floor lamp stands against the wall, near the end of the window seat.
the north wall

Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the north wall of the hall; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall. Tall oak bookcases flank a pair of windows which look out onto the porch; under each window is an armchair. A floor lamp stands between the armchairs, against the short section of walls between the windows.
the south wall

Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the south wall of the hall; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall, up to the ceiling cornice. Set in the middle of the south wall is a rugged fireplace, flanked by low oak bookcases. Framed portraits hang on either side of the chimney.
the west wall

Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the west wall of the hall; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall, up to the ceiling cornice. An oak-panelled door is set in the wall.
the window seat

A window bay protrudes from the northern end of the east wall; a sort of padded sofa, or long windowseat, is built under the window. It is cushioned with rich red leather. A floor lamp stands against the wall, just south of the windowseat.
the east window

A window is built into the eastern wall, looking out onto the patio. There is a sort of built-in sofa, or windowseat, under the window. A floor lamp stands just south of the windowseat, against the wall. The window gives a view of the patio.
the north windows

A pair of windows are set in the north wall, looking out onto the porch. They are flanked by tall oak bookcases; an armchair is set below each window, and a floor lamp stands between them. The window gives a view of the dim porch.

Notes:Category.Notes:Note: A room for pleasant conversation in the mansion.
